thread.title: Uniqlo maintains September sales momentum

title: Uniqlo maintains September sales momentum
text:
Font size Email Print 
Cool weather boosted sales of autumn/winter ranges in September 
Casual clothing brand Uniqlo booked an increase in sales at its Japanese stores for the second consecutive month in September, as cooler weather drove demand for autumn/winter ranges. 
Same store sales were up 2.6% year-on-year, while sales at its directly-run stores increased 3.1%. Total sales, including online sales, grew 3.4%. 
The Fast Retailing -owned chain said comparatively cool weather throughout the month helped new autumn/winter ranges get “off to a strong start”. Uniqlo opened one store in September, but closed two, taking its total store count to 802. 
In August, the brand saw sales at its directly-run stores increase 3%, after a 1.4% drop in July and an 11.5% decline in June. 
Earlier this year, Fast Retailing highlighted the progress it has made with monitoring and improving working conditions at its textile supplier factories following a series of alleged violations earlier this year.
